page.title: 03COMMUNICATIONS W'B'NE VALLEY
page.content: Communications are available by telephone and post. Most houses have telephones carried by overhead wires, paid for by quarterly rental and user charges. Post is delivered daily by post office van; there is no post office. Letter boxes are emptied by GPO van twice daily, but once on Saturday and not on Sunday. South east of the village is a television relay mast. National and local newspapers can be delivered daily. There is a local evening paper. The Citizens Band radio is made use of quite widely especially in farming activity.
